example: I love to travel around the world and experience different cultures.
logic: 无固定形状，像溶剂一样在世界这个容器里扩散。

example: We're planning a trip to the mountains next month.
logic: 通常指短途、有目的的往返。想象从 A 点弹跳到 B 点。

example: The band is on a world tour.
logic: 绕着特定的路线转一圈，最后回到原点。

example: The journey by train is very scenic.
logic: 强调在路上的时间感和跨度，不一定回到原点。

example: The Titanic's maiden voyage was tragic.
logic: 涉及巨大空间的跨越，通常指水上或宇宙。

example: We're going on vacation to the beach this summer.
logic: 清空大脑和工作，留下空白的时间。

example: She is preparing for the exam.
logic: 在事情发生前，先把需要的零件生产出来。

example: You need a valid passport to travel abroad.
logic: 通过港口/关口的通行证。没有它，物理边界无法穿透。

example: He works at the embassy.
logic: 本国在外国领土上的能量延伸点。

example: Please use the emergency exit in case of fire.
logic: Ex(出) + It(走)。指向外部的离去动作。

example: Entry to the museum is free.
logic: 向内部空间的切入动作。

example: The new administration has implemented reforms.
logic: Minister(仆人)。像执行者一样去打理事务。

example: He works in the Ministry of Education.
logic: 政府这个大机器里的一个执行部件。

example: We need to pay attention to security when traveling.
logic: Se(分开) + Cure(挂念)。把不安全感隔离开。

example: I need to apply for a visa to go to that country.
logic: 官方已经“看”过并确认了你的背景。

example: He applied for a job in the company.
logic: 将自己“折叠”并投递出去。引申为涂抹或申请。

example: The government will issue new policies.
logic: 像水从出口流出。杂志发行、政策发布、问题的冒出。

example: The local authorities are responsible for public order.
logic: 规则的创作者，即拥有掌控权的人。

example: He left his luggage at the airport.
logic: 强调需要费力拖动的东西。物理属性强。

example: How much baggage can I take on the plane?
logic: 比Luggage更抽象，可指心理包袱。

example: I booked the hotel through a travel agency.
logic: 帮你“做事”的地方。中介、代理。

example: We reserved a table at the restaurant.
logic: 提前往回拉住，不让别人拿走。

example: We stayed at a cozy inn in the mountains.
logic: 路人可以进入躲避风雨的小空间。

example: The accommodation in this hotel is very comfortable.
logic: 提供一种适合人居住的空间模式。

example: The dormitory is equipped with modern facilities.
logic: 专门提供集体睡眠能量回收的场所。

example: He has a beautiful residence in the countryside.
logic: Re(反复) + Sid(坐)。一个人反复坐下的地方，即家。

example: Take the escalator to the second floor.
logic: 像比例尺一样一阶一阶向上提升。

example: The elevator is out of order.
logic: Lev(轻)。使重物变轻并垂直运送的机器。

example: We met in the lobby of the hotel.
logic: 连接外部世界与内部房间的灰空间。

example: The reception at the hotel was very warm.
logic: Re(回) + Cept(拿)。把访客接进来。

example: I need to take my laundry to the laundry.
logic: 水的流动带走污垢的场所。

example: The departure time of the flight is 9 o'clock.
logic: De(离开) + Part(部分)。从原来的部分分离开。

example: Please check your luggage before you leave.
logic: 停下来确认状态。支票是对账单的确认。

example: Our destination is a small town by the sea.
logic: 终点即命运，是你必须抵达的那个坐标。

example: The Great Wall is a major tourist attraction in China.
logic: Tract(拉)。一股把你吸引过去的力量或场所。

example: We should protect our cultural heritage.
logic: 时间维度上，从祖辈流传下来的能量。

example: We visited the history museum last weekend.
logic: 存放艺术与科学灵感的圣殿。

example: There is an art exhibition in the gallery.
logic: 词源同Gal(快乐)，让人享受视觉愉悦的走廊。

example: The cathedral is a magnificent building.
logic: 拥有主教宝座的最高规格教堂。

example: I bought a lot of souvenirs during my trip.
logic: Sou(下) + Ven(来)。让记忆在脑海下方浮现出来的物体。

example: We took a drive along the scenic route.
logic: 美得像舞台布景一样的风景。

example: It was a pleasant trip.
logic: 满足感官，没有攻击性的愉悦。

example: The city has many attractive places to visit.
logic: 像磁铁一样能拉住目光的状态。

example: The story is really fascinating.
logic: 美到像中了魔法一样，完全无法移开眼。

example: The view from the top of the mountain is marvelous.
logic: 像精美雕刻一样令人惊叹的。

example: The village is really picturesque.
logic: 美得可以直接装进画框里。

example: The palace is magnificent.
logic: Magni(大) + Fic(做)。宏大到震慑灵魂的美。
